oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A&I Instructor due to return to India as Agricultural Advisor, Nashville, Tennessee, 1958 August 28
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Caption from Nashville Banner, August 28th, 1958: “The Harold M. Jones family delightedly watch little Carlotta Jones, 3, finger a massive tiger head their father shot as they make preparations to return to India Sept. 1 for another year. Another daughter, Estrella, 7, holds a deer head trophy from India.” Mr. Jones, an instructor in agricultural engineering at Tennessee A&I University, spent two years in Central India, Madha, Pradah, as advisor on establishment of a farm machinery training center. He was asked by the Indian Government to return via a program sponsored by the International Cooperation Administration, which is a part of the U. S. Mutual Aid Program. Forms part of Nashville Banner Negatives Collection. 1 photographic negative : b & w ; 4 x 5 in.
